fr.gouv.vitam.tools.mailextract.lib.core

Class StoreExtractor

  • Object
    • fr.gouv.vitam.tools.mailextract.lib.core.StoreExtractor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JMStoreExtractor, MsgStoreExtractor, PstEmbeddedStoreExtractor, PstStoreExtractor

    public abstract class StoreExtractor
extends Object
    Abstract factory class for operation context on a defined mailbox or mail file.

    The createStoreExtractor call create a StoreExtractor subclass convenient for the declared protocol. This creation specify the target of extraction, the different options of extraction, or listing, and the log level. It makes a first level of connection and compliance check to warranty other methods calls a viable mail box access. The StoreExtractor use sub class extractors to manage different protocols or formats (called schemes). There are defaults sub class for:

    • IMAP/IMAPS/POP3 (GIMAP experimental) server with user/password login
    • Thunderbird directory containing mbox files and .sbd directory hierarchy
    • mbox file
    • eml file
    • Outlook pst file
    • Msg file
    Notice: you have to call initDefaultExtractors method before any usage to benefit from these existing extractors, and you can add new ones with addExtractionRelation, and they will be automatically used when needed.

    The extraction generate on disk a directories/files structure convenient for SEDA archive packet (NF Z44-022), which is:

    • each folder is extracted as a directory named "Folder#'UniqID': 'name'", with uniqID being a unique ID innerly generated and name being the n first characters of the folder name UTF-8 encoded (n is defined by the option namesLength, default being 12). The folder descriptive metadata is in the file named ArchiveUnitContent.xml (XML/UTF-8 encoded) in its directory. It represent the folder ArchiveUnit with no objects
    • each message is extracted in a directory named "Message#'UniqID': 'name'", with name being the n first characters of the message title UTF-8 encoded. It represent the message ArchiveUnit. In this message directory, there's:
      • the message descriptive metadata file (ArchiveUnitContent.xml),
      • one directory for each special attachments being extractible stores (attached messages or attached files formatted in eml, msg, pst...) (if any)
        • if simple message, it's named "Message#'UniqID': 'name'", with name being the n first characters of the message title UTF-8 encoded, and contents the message extraction,
        • if complex extraction, it's named "Container#'UniqID': 'name'", with name being the n first characters of the attachment name (if non default to 'infile') UTF-8 encoded, and contents the container descriptive metadata file (ArchiveUnitContent.xml) and the hierarchy of extracted folders, messages, attachments...
      • one directory by attachment (if any) named "Attachment#'UniqID': 'name'" with the name being the n first characters of the attachment filename. In this folder are :
        • the attachment descriptive metadata file (ArchiveUnitContent.xml), and
        • the attachment binary file, being a final object, named according the format "'ObjectType'-'Version'-'filename'", with in this case ObjectType being "BinaryMaster", version being "1", filename being the attachment file name with extension if any.
        • the text version of attachment binary file, if option is set, named according the format "'ObjectType'-'Version'-'filename'", with in this case ObjectType being "TextContent", version being "1", filename being the attachment file name with extension if any.
      • the message body in eml format file, being a final object, named "BinaryMaster_1_'messageID'" with the messageID being the n first characters of the uniq messageID , and
      • the message body in text format file, if option is set, being a final object, named "TextContent_1_'messageID'" with the messageID being the n first characters of the uniq messageID.
    Note: any folder's name is modified with starting and ending "__" when the ArchiveUnit, the folder represents, contains an object.

    For detailed information on descritptive metadata collected see StoreFolder and StoreMessage.

    The extraction or listing operation is logged on console and file (root/username[-timestamp].log - cf args). At the different levels (using Logger) you can have: extraction errors (SEVERE), warning about extraction problems and items dropped (WARNING), information about global process (INFO), list of treated folders (FINE), list of treated messages (FINER), problems with some expected metadata (FINEST).

    Note: Metadata values are, for now, hardcoded in french

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected String description
      Extractor context description.
      protected String destName
      Name of the extraction directory.
      protected String destRootPath
      Path of the directory where will be the extraction directory.
      protected String host
      Hostname of target store in ((hostname|ip)[:port]) *.
      protected StoreExtractorOptions options
      Extractor options, flags coded on an int, defined thru constants *.
      protected String password
      Password, can be null if not used *.
      protected String path
      Path of ressource to extract *.
      protected int port
      Port of target store in ((hostname|ip)[:port]) *.
      protected String scheme
      Scheme defining specific store extractor (imap| imaps| pop3| thunderbird| mbox| eml| pst| msg| experimental gimap)...)
      protected String storeFolder
      Path of the folder in the store used as root for extraction, can be null if default root folder.
      protected String user
      User account name, can be null if not used *.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StoreExtractor

        protected StoreExtractor(String urlString,
                         String storeFolder,
                         String destPathString,
                         StoreExtractorOptions options,
                         StoreExtractor rootStoreExtractor,
                         java.util.logging.Logger logger,
                         java.io.PrintStream psExtractList)
                  throws ExtractionException
        Instantiates a new store extractor.
        Parameters:
        urlString - the url string
        storeFolder - Path of the extracted folder in the store box, can be null if default root folder
        destPathString - the dest path string
        options - Extractor options
        rootStoreExtractor - the creating store extractor in nested extraction, or null if root one
        logger - Logger used (from Logger)
        psExtractList - the ps extract list
        Throws:
        ExtractionException - Any unrecoverable extraction exception (access trouble, major format problems...)

    • Method Detail

      • initDefaultExtractors

        public static void initDefaultExtractors()
        Subscribes all defaults store extractor.

      • addExtractionRelation

        public static void addExtractionRelation(String mimeType,
                                         String scheme,
                                         boolean isContainer,
                                         Class extractor)
        Add mimetypes, scheme, isContainer, store extractor known relation.

        This is used by store extractor sub classes to subscribe. When the relation is known it can be used for processing automatically the mimetype files with appropriate store extractors, in code.

        Warning: the mime type has to be the code returned by tika!

        Parameters:
        mimeType - the mime type
        scheme - the scheme
        isContainer - the is container
        extractor - the extractor

      • composeStoreURL

        public static String composeStoreURL(String scheme,
                                     String authority,
                                     String user,
                                     String password,
                                     String path)
        Compose an URL String.
        Parameters:
        scheme - Type of local store to extract (thunderbird|pst|eml|mbox) or protocol for server access (imap|imaps|pop3...)
        authority - Server:port of target account ((hostname|ip)[:port
        user - User account name, can be null if not used
        password - Password, can be null if not used
        path - Path to the ressource
        Returns:
        the string

      • getLogger

        public java.util.logging.Logger getLogger()
        Gets the logger created during the store extractor construction, and used in all mailextract classes.

        For convenience each class which may have some log actions has it's own getLogger method always returning this store extractor logger.

        Returns:
        logger

      • getUniqID

        public int getUniqID()
        Gets a uniq ID in store extractor context.

        Sequence incremented at each call in root store extractor context to garanty unicity for the whole extraction process even in nested extractions.

        Returns:
        a uniq ID

      • getTotalRawSize

        public long getTotalRawSize()
        Gets the total raw size of all analyzed elements.

        The "raw" size is the sum of the size of elements as in the store, the extraction will be larger (up to x2)

        Returns:
        the total raw size

      • createStoreExtractor

        public static StoreExtractor createStoreExtractor(String urlString,
                                                  String storeFolder,
                                                  String destPathString,
                                                  StoreExtractorOptions options,
                                                  java.util.logging.Logger logger,
                                                  java.io.PrintStream psExtractList)
                                           throws ExtractionException
        Create a store extractor for the declared scheme in url as a factory creator.
        Parameters:
        urlString - the url string
        storeFolder - Path of the extracted folder in the account mail box, can be null if default root folder
        destPathString - the dest path string
        options - Options (flag composition of CONST_)
        logger - Logger used (from Logger)
        psExtractList - the ps extract list
        Returns:
        the store extractor, constructed as a non abstract subclass
        Throws:
        ExtractionException - Any unrecoverable extraction exception (access trouble, major format problems...)

      • extractAllFolders

        public void extractAllFolders()
                       throws ExtractionException
        Extract all folders from the defined root folder (considering drop options).

        This is a method where the extraction structure and content is partially defined (see also extractMessage and extractFolder).

        Throws:
        ExtractionException - Any unrecoverable extraction exception (access trouble, major format problems...)

      • listAllFolders

        public void listAllFolders(boolean stats)
                    throws ExtractionException
        List all folders from the defined root folder (no drop options).

        Warning: listing with detailed information is a potentially expensive operation, especially when accessing distant account, as all elements are inspected (in the case of a distant account that mean also downloaded...).

        Parameters:
        stats - true if detailed information (number and raw size of elements in each folder) is asked for
        Throws:
        ExtractionException - Any unrecoverable extraction exception (access trouble, major format problems...)

      • endStoreExtractor

        public void endStoreExtractor()
                       throws ExtractionException
        Do all end tasks for the StoreExtractor, like deleting temporary files.
        Throws:
        ExtractionException - the extraction exception
